First bullshit, seven seconds in. OBAMA called it "Obamacare" until it proved to be a disaster. Second bullshit, 35 seconds in. The SUPREME COURT ruled it is a tax. See Ben Swann's recent video on the topic, where actual FACTS about this un_Constitutional tax are explained. So, your "non-political" pimping for Obama is pretty transparent. FAIL.

The most disastrous mistake in this video is mis-stating the real Individual Mandate tax for individuals.  That tax may be up to 8% per individual per year.

"For families the tax will be $2,085 or 2.5% percent of household income, whichever is greater. The requirement can be waived for several reasons, including financial hardship or religious beliefs. If the tax would exceed 8% of your income you are exempt, also some religious groups are exempt. That tax cannot exceed the cost of a "bronze plan" bought on the exchange." Taken from http://obamacarefacts.com/obamacare-taxes.php a Pro-Obamacare facts site

It is critically important to note the cost of not carrying insurance will not be exempted until the taxation hits 8%.  As most people know, net income can vary a lot year over year, and the IRS will assume that you automatically are paying 2.5% of your gross income for this tax penalty.  It will be up to the individual filing with the IRS to show deductions and credits that reduce their income such that the 2.5% of gross income is greater than 8% of net income.

How does that happen?  For example, you're a college or university student with a full time job to pay your way to minimize the amount of student loans you need.  Or you go through stretches of unemployment.  Or you have a major life changing event like hospitalization or a new child.  Or you lose the sole provider in your family.  Or a calamity places you in a natural disaster zone.  In any of these cases you may not be able to afford a health care plan, are not eligible for subsidies because of prior earnings or income status, and will face the 2.5% full tax penalty calculated without factoring in costs, losses, etc.

If the law was written such that the maximum tax was 2.5% of income and you were exempt if the tax exceeded 2.5% of income or the tax could not exceed 2.5% of income then that would mean this video was accurate.  The law is written that the tax is 2.5% of income and if it exceeds 8% of income then you are exempt.  Historically, the IRS will take the maximum tax it is allowed to capture.  That means the IRS will take up to 8% whenever possible.  It's the individual's responsibility to try and claw back the difference between 2.5% and 8%, and going to Tax Court is never a winning proposition.

Income from self-employment and wages of single individuals in excess of $200,000 annually will be subject to an additional tax of 0.9%.
